summary: I'm just a hufflepuff that the world has taught to mistrust and hate everyone. If that doesn't make you sad, idk what will..

summary: It’s tonight! I’m watching Fantastic Beasts today!
body:
It’s tonight! I’m watching Fantastic Beasts today!

Honestly I thought i was going be less excited but I cannot help it gives me so much nostalgia.

blog.name: girafeduvexin
blog.title: Pratiquante professionnelle du sapphisme
blog.description:
réincarnation de Barbara ; lesbienne cis/cis lesbian (terf don't follow/interact I block on sight) ; Lila/Miriam (birth name/hebrew name); white ; jewish (by choice ✡); proustienne ; fatiguée
(#selfie to see my face, #mes écrits to read me, #jewish tag for judaism - mostly in french)

tags: first time in my life i participate in a week
summary: Okay I joked about Snape being half-french but what if he was. What if he was called... Severus Rogue. For Canon AU week (edit...
body:
Okay I joked about Snape being half-french but what if he was. What if he was called… Severus Rogue. For Canon AU week (edit @snapeloveposts forgot to tag !!) :

- According to Eileen Prince’s parents, she decided to marry a french muggle only to annoy them.

- They weren’t wrong. Eileen would agree.

- But if she had to be honest (which never happened nowadays), she did fall in love with Tobias.

- She loved his name, Tobias Rogue, an unusual name, old french name. She spoke french very well, she did have some ancient french ancestry. Tobias never really tried to pronounce her name right : Eileen soon became Hélène, and Prince in the french way. She loved it first. She hated it years after.

- She used to love how he knew nothing of magic, how he loved her without thinking about it.

- Then, she ended up pregnant. They couldn’t decide on a french or an english name, so they called him Severus. A latin name, the kind of name wizards from all countries would choose - but Tobias didn’t know that yet.

- In many ways, her flight to France was a middle finger to her parents, nothing more. Nothing serious. When they wrote her she wasn’t their daughter anymore, it felt wrong. It was too much.

- But it was also too late.

- When she understood she could never convince her parents to take her back, she became bitter.

- She made a vow : his son will be everything she wasn’t. A powerful, respected slytherin - not a depressed housewife in the french suburbs.

- They lived in what french authorities called a “sensitive zone”. Severus grew up between HLM, in a “climate of insecurity”, as french politicians would say.

- He liked it though. It was lively. Her mother hated living there, but they had no choice.

- She was pleased when Severus’s magic appeared. Tobias wasn’t.

- He felt without understanding it that his wife was distancing herself and his son from him. She was talking to Severus in english about “wizards”, and that was the only word he could understand. He still didn’t speak of english, after so many years.

- Soon, he associated magic with english and England, “ces conneries de sorciers”, because Eileen only knew the british wizard society, and that was the only thing she talked about.

- Severus remembered, before he knew about magic, dinner conversations, when his mum will speak french with his dad. Sometimes, she will say something in english, and his dad will ask, amused, a translation.

- This time was gone.

- Now, his mother only spoke to him in english, using french as a bare minimum to adress his father. Tobias hated it, always thinking she was talking about some magic stuff in a language he couldn’t understand, when she was just asking for the salt.

- But french was Severus’s native language. He was dreaming in french. He was going to a french muggle school. And his english was good, excellent for a young kid, but it still wasn’t his first language.

- She started to imagine him, eleven years old, lost in Hogwarts, rejected. She didn’t even consider Beauxbatons : her son was going to be a Slytherin.

- He had to be excellent at english lessons : one mistake, and she made him work way past bedtime. He was soon bilingual, but it still wasn’t enough.

- Some days, she wanted to obliviate french out of him.

- Severus was confused. He wanted to please his mother and his father at the same time, but it was impossible. When he blurted something in french in front of Eileen, she ignored him for weeks. When he said something in english in front of Tobias, he looked at him with hatred.

- Her mother sent him every summer since he was seven tears old to England, helped by the municipality, in a host family.

- They were called the Evans and they had two daughters. They were friendly, except Petunia, the eldest daughter, who didn’t like him.

- Lily, the youngest one, revealed herself to be a witch. Eileen couldn’t be more happy.

- He liked Lily, partly because she was nice and they could talk about magic together, partly because his mother was pleased when he talked about her.

- He was already seeing both of them in Hogwarts, sorted into Slytherin.

- His acceptance letter from Beauxbatons was a shock.

- Eileen went to Hogwarts, she cried, she threatened Dumbledore, but it didn’t work.

- And Severus went to Beauxbatons.

- He could have liked it here, if his mother didn’t criticize everything.

- “They don’t have houses ? Pathetic. How do they call a rememball ? A "Rapeltout” ? That’s ridiculous.“

- He couldn’t speak with her about school ; his good grades didn’t matter much to her.

- His father treated him less like a son but more like a stranger.

- Even his summers wasn’t fun anymore : Lily was talking about Hogwarts, about her friends, using magical words he only knew in french. His mother had convinced him he was in a school of very poor quality. He was jealous of Lily, he was dreaming about Hogwarts.

- When he came back to home at the end of his third year, his mother told him, as it was nothing, that his father died in a work accident two months ago.

- She "forgot” to write him about it.

- Tobias worked in a factory - it was plausible but he always wondered if Eileen had something to do with it. He knew better than to ask.

- He didn’t like his father a lot, but he still felt sad. He wished he could have say goodbye, but they moved quickly to England.

- And he was transferred to Hogwarts for his fourth year.

- He didn’t see Lily of all summer, but he met her on the Hogwarts Express.

- She was happy to see him, and to go to school with him, but she was a little worried when he told her he hoped to be sorted into Slytherin. She knew some mean guys in Slytherin “but you’re not someone like that, right, Severus ?”

- A group of boys came to see them. A certain James Potter wanted to ask Lily to go on a date with him - it happened often, apparently. Lily refused, again. She didn’t seem to like him a lot.

- James didn’t like too much seeing a boy he didn’t know talking to Lily Evans.

- “It’s my friend, Severus, she said. We met when we were kids ! He’s from Beauxbatons.”

- “I’m going to be a Slytherin, Severus added, feeling proud already.”

- James Potter was not his mom, and he didn’t like Slytherins. Neither his friends.

- Severus was indeed sorted in Slytherin, but he felt guilty when he realized he missed Beauxbatons. What would his mother think ?

- He was a brilliant student… in french. He was bilingual but he had to learn english magical vocabulary. It was frustating to have bad grades in subjects he knew he would have excelled in Beauxbatons.

- Being sorted in fourth years was weird. The only friend he had was in Gryffindor. Slytherins didn’t know him, and at first, they kept their distance. He was alone.

- James and his friends started soon to bully him. It was easy : he had only one friend, he was in a school he didn’t know very well, and Lily couldn’t be with him all the time. No one could help him.

- After all, Lily had her own friends in Hogwarts. Severus was a “summer friend” to her.

- He worked hard and he became again a excellent student. At the beginning of his fifth year, slytherins started to accept him, mostly because he was always winning house points with his grades. His mother was proud, finally.

- When some slytherins talked about muggles, and how much they hated them, he thought of Eileen and Tobias first, then Lily.

- He loved Lily, but he wanted his mother to love him.

- He felt like a child again, trapped between Tobias and Eileen.

- In the end, the Shrieking Shack, then the “mudblood” incident made him choose.

- When he left Hogwarts, he was what his mother wanted : a brilliant Slytherin.

BONUS : a Rogue playlist.

(I’m working on a sequel - Rogue as a death eater, then a teacher etc)

(Yes my english is bad you can read all of that with Fleur Delacour’s accent)

- But french was Severus’s native language. He was dreaming in french. He was going to a french muggle school. And his english was good, excellent for a young kid, but it still wasn’t his first language.

- She started to imagine him, eleven years old, lost in Hogwarts, rejected. She didn’t even consider Beauxbatons : her son was going to be a Slytherin.

- He had to be excellent at english lessons : one mistake, and she made him work way past bedtime. He was soon bilingual, but it still wasn’t enough.

- Some days, she wanted to obliviate french out of him.

- Severus was confused. He wanted to please his mother and his father at the same time, but it was impossible. When he blurted something in french in front of Eileen, she ignored him for weeks. When he said something in english in front of Tobias, he looked at him with hatred.

- Her mother sent him every summer since he was seven tears old to England, helped by the municipality, in a host family.

- They were called the Evans and they had two daughters. They were friendly, except Petunia, the eldest daughter, who didn’t like him.

- Lily, the youngest one, revealed herself to be a witch. Eileen couldn’t be more happy.

- He liked Lily, partly because she was nice and they could talk about magic together, partly because his mother was pleased when he talked about her.

- He was already seeing both of them in Hogwarts, sorted into Slytherin.

- His acceptance letter from Beauxbatons was a shock.

- Eileen went to Hogwarts, she cried, she threatened Dumbledore, but it didn’t work.

- And Severus went to Beauxbatons.

- He could have liked it here, if his mother didn’t criticize everything.

- “They don’t have houses ? Pathetic. How do they call a rememball ? A "Rapeltout” ? That’s ridiculous.“

- He couldn’t speak with her about school ; his good grades didn’t matter much to her.

- His father treated him less like a son but more like a stranger.

- Even his summers wasn’t fun anymore : Lily was talking about Hogwarts, about her friends, using magical words he only knew in french. His mother had convinced him he was in a school of very poor quality. He was jealous of Lily, he was dreaming about Hogwarts.

- When he came back to home at the end of his third year, his mother told him, as it was nothing, that his father died in a work accident two months ago.

- She "forgot” to write him about it.

- Tobias worked in a factory - it was plausible but he always wondered if Eileen had something to do with it. He knew better than to ask.

- He didn’t like his father a lot, but he still felt sad. He wished he could have say goodbye, but they moved quickly to England.

- And he was transferred to Hogwarts for his fourth year.

- He didn’t see Lily of all summer, but he met her on the Hogwarts Express.

- She was happy to see him, and to go to school with him, but she was a little worried when he told her he hoped to be sorted into Slytherin. She knew some mean guys in Slytherin “but you’re not someone like that, right, Severus ?”

- A group of boys came to see them. A certain James Potter wanted to ask Lily to go on a date with him - it happened often, apparently. Lily refused, again. She didn’t seem to like him a lot.

- James didn’t like too much seeing a boy he didn’t know talking to Lily Evans.

- “It’s my friend, Severus, she said. We met when we were kids ! He’s from Beauxbatons.”

- “I’m going to be a Slytherin, Severus added, feeling proud already.”

- James Potter was not his mom, and he didn’t like Slytherins. Neither his friends.

- Severus was indeed sorted in Slytherin, but he felt guilty when he realized he missed Beauxbatons. What would his mother think ?

- He was a brilliant student… in french. He was bilingual but he had to learn english magical vocabulary. It was frustating to have bad grades in subjects he knew he would have excelled in Beauxbatons.

- Being sorted in fourth years was weird. The only friend he had was in Gryffindor. Slytherins didn’t know him, and at first, they kept their distance. He was alone.

- James and his friends started soon to bully him. It was easy : he had only one friend, he was in a school he didn’t know very well, and Lily couldn’t be with him all the time. No one could help him.

- After all, Lily had her own friends in Hogwarts. Severus was a “summer friend” to her.

- He worked hard and he became again a excellent student. At the beginning of his fifth year, slytherins started to accept him, mostly because he was always winning house points with his grades. His mother was proud, finally.

- When some slytherins talked about muggles, and how much they hated them, he thought of Eileen and Tobias first, then Lily.

- He loved Lily, but he wanted his mother to love him.

- He felt like a child again, trapped between Tobias and Eileen.

- In the end, the Shrieking Shack, then the “mudblood” incident made him choose.

- When he left Hogwarts, he was what his mother wanted : a brilliant Slytherin.

BONUS : a Rogue playlist.

(I’m working on a sequel - Rogue as a death eater, then a teacher etc)

(Yes my english is bad you can read all of that with Fleur Delacour’s accent)

summary: Harry Potter Wizard Training Wands Review
title: Harry Potter Wizard Training Wands Review
body:
Harry Potter Wizard Training Wands Review #WizardTrainingWands @JAKKSToys

As a big fan of the Harry Potter series, we all have fond memories of them practising their wand twirling action and casting the spell over and over again, hoping that they’re able to cast the right spell and not accidentally cause anyone to vomit slugs!

To celebrate the Fantastic Beasts 2 movie release on this coming Friday, we have received the brand new Hermione Granger Wizard Training wand…

Scorpius: Professor?
Harry: Yes?

body:
Scorpius: Professor?
Harry: Yes?
Scorpius: My father told me to tell you that...*sigh* that he loves you and wants you to come have dinner sometime
Harry: Oh how sweet, tell him that I love...
Scorpius: Why can't you speak to each other like normal people? I'm not an owl!

summary: Lecturing clueless men on their sexism never led to anything good. Pureblood wizards tended to be the worst of the lot; even Ron...
text:
Lecturing clueless men on their sexism never led to anything good. Pureblood wizards tended to be the worst of the lot; even Ron was rather bad on that score. Instead she forced herself to smile and say, “Because you refused to admit that you were helping me out in the classroom.”

“Right.” He nodded. “I wasn’t.”

“So, when you’re talking about womanly needs–”

He abruptly stood. “The Headmistress ordered it, so stop it!”

Hermione was still laughing long after he’d gone.

summary: Genderbent soulmates AU? Possibly Draco and Harry please and thanks. ❤
question: Genderbent soulmates AU? Possibly Draco and Harry please and thanks. ❤
answer:
Thank you for the ask! I’m not comfortable writing genderbent, it’s really not my thing. I took the rest of the request tho! Hope you like it! And all the thanks to the amazing @dapperdrarry for the quick beta!!

They called him a freak for a lot of reasons: his skin, his scar, his lack of a red string, the strange happenings that followed him. Harry agreed with them. He was strange.

When he had been young he’d hated being strange. Many a night were spent sitting up in the dark, wishing and wishing with all his heart that he could be white and unblemished and normal. The idea that there was no one in the world tied to him, guaranteed to love him, was terrifying and heartbreaking.

The pain of lacking a soulmate never lessened, but Harry came to cherish the other bits of his oddness. His body was his, and him, and he loved it, even if no one else would. Strange happenings and magic were rather synonymous, and even as he uncovered the horrors magic could create, he held it close to his heart.

Harry had himself, and he had magic. Most of the time, he had friends who stood by him and cared about him as well. Maybe he’d never stop wanting a soulmate—by the time he was fourteen, though, he’d stopped seeing an image of himself in a mirror with a red string tied to his pinky every time he slept.

On the second of May, nineteen ninety-seven, he walked to meet his death and felt glad, for the first time in his life, that there was no red string tying him to someone else. His death wouldn’t cause a soulmate pain. Untied, unattached, he could leave this world with an unburdened conscience.

—

The first sensation he was aware of was breath filling his lungs. The cool air stung his insides as it was pulled in and pushed out. Slowly, his hands and arms and legs and aching head and ribs prickled into his awareness, and Harry realized that he was alive.

Had he made the right decision? By the time Hagrid had picked him up Harry came to the decision that he had. He would finish Voldemort, and he would live a life worth coming back for.

Voldemort laid dead a few meters away. The distance was at once short, and an endless abyss. It was over. Harry had prevailed. Hope had won.

This was the moment that he looked down to marvel at the Elder Wand in his hand and saw a splash of red as well. Blood, his mind supplied, but no—

A string was neatly tied to Harry’s pinky finger.

“Harry?” He spun around and stared at Hermione for a moment before dropping his gaze back to his finger. When he looked back to her a moment later he saw the realization on her face.

“They’re here,” he said. His voice was rough but passionate. The tug on the string was sharp, seeming to pull at his magic, begging him to follow it.

“Go,” she whispered. “You’ve earned this. Merlin, Harry…”

He took off running, letting both wands fall to the ground. Harry only had eyes for the string, leading ahead of him and guiding his way.

People would begin to call out to him as he passed them, but then stop and gasp when they saw the string. The marvellous string, famously missing from the Boy Who Lived—but present, now, on the Boy Who Lived Twice.

Cheers broke out, and the exhausted survivors crowded after him in excitement. They’d won, and this seemed a symbol of it. Happiness had been won.

Harry wound his way through the rubble up into the castle. Mrs. Weasley, Professor McGonagall, Seamus and Dean, Kingsley Shacklebolt, a hundred others made way for him as they understood what was happening.

The string suddenly rose off the ground, pulled perfectly taught, and Harry looked up. His gaze met wide, shocked silver eyes. Draco Malfoy was looking back at him, sitting on the base of a destroyed statue, sandwiched between his parents.

Malfoy glanced down at the string tied to his own finger, and then down the length of it to Harry’s, and back. He stood up hesitantly, taking slow, tentative steps forward.

“Potter?”

For several long moments that stretched into eternity, Harry despaired. How could he be tied to Malfoy? They were supposed to stand by each other when no one else would? To care and love and cherish?

But then, he knew, as surely as he knew his name, that that was exactly what they were going to do.

“Draco.”

Something new, and different, and fresh as hope sparkled in Draco’s eyes. He reached Harry and stood just before him, moving his untied hand to lay it flat against Harry’s chest.

“Harry,” he whispered. It sounded like a promise.

reblog.comment:
Thank you for the ask! I’m not comfortable writing genderbent, it’s really not my thing. I took the rest of the request tho! Hope you like it! And all the thanks to the amazing @dapperdrarry for the quick beta!!

The idea that there was no one in the world tied to him, guaranteed to love him, was terrifying and heartbreaking.

The pain of lacking a soulmate never lessened, but Harry came to cherish the other bits of his oddness. His body was his, and him, and he loved it, even if no one else would. Harry had himself, and he had magic. Most of the time, he had friends who stood by him and cared about him as well. Had he made the right decision? By the time Hagrid had picked him up Harry came to the decision that he had. He would finish Voldemort, and he would live a life worth coming back for.

Voldemort laid dead a few meters away. The distance was at once short, and an endless abyss. It was over. Harry had prevailed. Hope had won.

This was the moment that he looked down to marvel at the Elder Wand in his hand and saw a splash of red as well. Blood, his mind supplied, but no—

“They’re here,” he said. His voice was rough but passionate. The tug on the string was sharp, seeming to pull at his magic, begging him to follow it.

“Go,” she whispered. “You’ve earned this. Merlin, Harry…”

He took off running, letting both wands fall to the ground. Harry only had eyes for the string, leading ahead of him and guiding his way.

People would begin to call out to him as he passed them, but then stop and gasp when they saw the string. The marvellous string, famously missing from the Boy Who Lived—but present, now, on the Boy Who Lived Twice.

Cheers broke out, and the exhausted survivors crowded after him in excitement. They’d won, and this seemed a symbol of it. Happiness had been won.

The string suddenly rose off the ground, pulled perfectly taught, and Harry looked up. His gaze met wide, shocked silver eyes. Draco Malfoy was looking back at him, sitting on the base of a destroyed statue, sandwiched between his parents.

Malfoy glanced down at the string tied to his own finger, and then down the length of it to Harry’s, and back. He stood up hesitantly, taking slow, tentative steps forward.

“Potter?”

For several long moments that stretched into eternity, Harry despaired. How could he be tied to Malfoy? They were supposed to stand by each other when no one else would? To care and love and cherish?

But then, he knew, as surely as he knew his name, that that was exactly what they were going to do.

“Draco.”

Something new, and different, and fresh as hope sparkled in Draco’s eyes. He reached Harry and stood just before him, moving his untied hand to lay it flat against Harry’s chest.

“Harry,” he whispered. It sounded like a promise.

People would begin to call out to him as he passed them, but then stop and gasp when they saw the string. The marvellous string, famously missing from the Boy Who Lived—but present, now, on the Boy Who Lived Twice.

Cheers broke out, and the exhausted survivors crowded after him in excitement. They’d won, and this seemed a symbol of it. Happiness had been won.

Harry wound his way through the rubble up into the castle. Mrs. Weasley, Professor McGonagall, Seamus and Dean, Kingsley Shacklebolt, a hundred others made way for him as they understood what was happening.

The string suddenly rose off the ground, pulled perfectly taught, and Harry looked up. His gaze met wide, shocked silver eyes. Draco Malfoy was looking back at him, sitting on the base of a destroyed statue, sandwiched between his parents.

Malfoy glanced down at the string tied to his own finger, and then down the length of it to Harry’s, and back. He stood up hesitantly, taking slow, tentative steps forward.

“Potter?”

For several long moments that stretched into eternity, Harry despaired. How could he be tied to Malfoy? They were supposed to stand by each other when no one else would? To care and love and cherish?

But then, he knew, as surely as he knew his name, that that was exactly what they were going to do.

“Draco.”

Something new, and different, and fresh as hope sparkled in Draco’s eyes. He reached Harry and stood just before him, moving his untied hand to lay it flat against Harry’s chest.

“Harry,” he whispered. It sounded like a promise.

summary:
THIS IS THE NIGHT

 TITN is a post-potter roleplay set in 2030 amidst a looming financial crisis with a distinct shift into...
caption:
THIS IS THE NIGHT

TITN is a post-potter roleplay set in 2030 amidst a looming financial crisis with a distinct shift into televised entertainment. 

We’re a tight-knit community that has been around for a while now, but we are always searching for new people to join the family. We are hoping to fill up our canon list, so please stop on by, and let us know if you have any questions!

blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!
